summary: A 2014 law requires federal agencies to have information security programs. The Office of Management and Budget oversees these efforts. We looked at how agencies and OMB have implemented the law and found: Of our sample of 16 agencies, most had weaknesses in most security control areas Inspectors General reported ineffective programs at 18 of 24 major agencies OMB coordinated cybersecurity review meetings with 3...
title: Federal Information Security: Agencies and OMB Need to Strengthen Policies and Practices
